title.narrative: Transparency and Accountability Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to contribute (i) to enhance transparency and efficiency in public financial management, and (ii) to strengthen accountability in the use of public resource. The project will play a key role in Cameroon in accelerating the pace toward a more orderly and open PFM and thus more efficient service delivery.

condition.narrative: Appointment of an accountant with the PFMTS, employed pursuant to terms of reference satisfactory to the Association
Appropriation of the amounts of the PFMRAP Annual Programs not financed by any donor in its draft annual Budget and ensureavailability of such annual budgeted amount for the activities of the PF
Development and adoption of HR legislative and regulatory framework, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association,beforeinitiation of HR and Payroll system procurement
Establish core ICT teams within the beneficiary organizations, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, beforeinitiating any ICT system procurement
Finalization of contractual arrangements for establishment of a countrywide network system connecting all provinces andministerial departments before initiation of ICT procurement process
Recruitment of an external auditor 4 months after effectiveness
adoption by November 30 of each year, of the PFMRAP Annual Programs and related budget, procurement plan and M&E plansatisfactoryto the Association.

title.narrative: Percentage of contracts above threshold procured through open competition, in selected ministries (Health, Education, Agriculture, Public Works, and Finance). (PI-19 i, modified).

baseline.value: (To be determined by project effectiveness) In Francs CFA value

comment.narrative: No change. Baseline data at project effectiveness were never produced.

title.narrative: Legal and regulatory texts to enforce the new Budget Law are signed and effective.

baseline.value: Application texts have not been drafted yet (first quarter 2008)

target.value: Decree on new budget nomenclature including programs, signed and effective

actual.value: Decree on new budget nomenclature not drafted.

comment.narrative: Presidential circulars on Budget execution monitoring and 2013 Budget preparation were published in 2012.

title.narrative: Public access to key fiscal information (PEFA PI-10)

comment.narrative: No new PEFA report. No major change since 2007 in PFM with regards to this indicator.

title.narrative: Scope of the legislature scrutiny of the annual budget law. (PI-27-i)

comment.narrative: No indication that value has changed from baseline at Nov. 2012 Parliament session.

title.narrative: Availability of information on resources received by service delivery units (PEFA PI-23)

comment.narrative: Not met. No new PETS exercise was produced in 2010, 2011 or 2012.
No new PEFA report. However, PETS2 report on 2009 budget was published in Dec. 2010 (NSI website in 2011)

title.narrative: Degree of integration and reconciliation between personnel records and payroll data. (PI-18 i)

comment.narrative: No structural change in using the HR and Payroll databases are effective and systematic yet. D+ indicate the gradual efforts since2005 in cleaning progressively the 2 databases (SIGIPES-ANTILOPES). Merging of the 2 databases is in preparation.

title.narrative: Timeliness of the issue of semi-annual budget reports (PI-24 ii)

comment.narrative: No PEFA report. Semi-annual budget reports are produced, but delay is superior to 8 weeks.

title.narrative: Completeness of the financial statements (in French, Loi de R#glement) (PI-25 i)

comment.narrative: No new PEFA report. (Assessment based on information provided by experts in the field with regards to LR 2011)

title.narrative: Timeliness of the release of semi-annual budget reports on available media (government websites, national newspapers)

baseline.value: No publication of semi-annual budget reports in PM websites and Cameroon Tribune.

actual.value: Semi-annual budget reports published in Cameroon Tribune only; Timeliness: 3 months

comment.narrative: Semi-annual 2012 budget report was published in Cameroon Tribune in Sept. 2012. Not available on PM, DGT, MINEPAT or Presidencywebsites.

title.narrative: Percentage of investment projects which are domestically financed in annual budget compliant with the new project legal and procedures framework.

comment.narrative: The new Public Investment Management system are not yet operational and Manual of administrative procedures are not yetcompleted.Therefore there is no data to confirm the compliance of project in 2013 budget.
